name: Max Forsey
short_description: Max Forsey is a researcher in artificial intelligence at the Perception Control and Cognition Lab at Brigham Young University. He is also the co-founder of justbuild and previously served as Vice President of BYU Artificial Intelligence Association.
long_description:
Max Forsey is an artificial intelligence researcher who studies the nature of AI at the Perception Control and Cognition Lab affiliated with Brigham Young University. His professional journey includes leadership roles in AI communities, serving as the Vice President of the BYU Artificial Intelligence Association from May 2024 to November 2024. 

In November 2024, Max co-founded justbuild, an organization focused on building and innovation in the tech space. He appears to be actively involved in the AI hackathon community, supporting and participating in events like the Utah Tech Week AI Hackathon and other short-format hackathons. His LinkedIn activity shows engagement with AI development, tech entrepreneurship, and community building.

Max has a substantial following on LinkedIn with 808 followers and over 500 connections, indicating his active presence in professional networks. His interests span across AI research, practical applications of artificial intelligence, and fostering communities around technology innovation. He collaborates with organizations like Sameday and Cerebras Systems for hosting AI hackathons and community events.
